messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] private schools
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 12/9/2002 9:36:33 AM Eastern Standard Time, ... Yes. They pay twice---unless they buy insurance . If they move or even if the child dies,
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 12/9/2002 9:36:33 AM Eastern Standard Time,
Earthmomma67@... writes:


> I've heard people mention this alot. What do parents who change private
> schools in the middle of the year do when the first school doesn't work
> out?
> They pay for two schools? What if they move out of state or 60 miles away?
> Are they then expected to pey for a school they aren't sending any children
>
> to?


Yes. They pay twice---unless they "buy insurance". If they move or even if
the child dies, they STILL must pay, unless they've purchased insurance.
That's about $300/year where we were.

~Kelly


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
